Replies.Reply: JIM'S FAMILY  JIM'S GRANDMA: A chic, domineering woman in her sixties who has made her son Frank dependent upon her for every breath he takes.  She is the irritant in the household--the silent ruler--the silent enemy of Frank's marriage.
That was pretty what you were whistling.  Whistle some more.
You smoke it.  Smoke it, Dad.
I'll light it for you, Dad.
Wanna make the colored lights go around and around?
Hey, he's real abstract and different.
Who's fighting?  This is the test, man.  It's a crazy game.
You know the action?  No cutting.
What you waiting on, Toreador?  I thought you wanted some action!
Big brave bull.  Hah!  Toro!  Hah!
You crud chicken!  You're wasting our time!
Yeah--that's pretty close.  How about a little closer, Toreador?
Split for what?  Couple old poopheads?
How 'bout you?  Say the word and you're cold, Jack--you're dead.
What's eating you, Judy?  You want him alive?
Draw him a picture, Chicken Little.
Why'nt you go suck on something sweet?
Goon!  You seen that adolescent type anywheres?
Come on.  Let's see what we're driving.
What you say your name was?
Better try the doors.  Jump out.
No--quick, man!  You got to break quick.
This is the edge, boy.  This is the end.
We got to do something.  Don't we?
Hey, Toreador!  She signals.  We head for the edge.  The first guy who jumps--chicken!
Mixed up in that beating on Twelfth Street?
This says he was picked up there.
Young squirt.  All right--You want to lean him against something?
What I could write about you they wouldn't print.
He's not here.  He's not at Juvenile Hall.  I don't know where he is.  He's out on a call and he'll be out all night.  How old are you?
Why don't you come back tomorrow, son?
They had him on the carpet for an hour at Headquarters.  He's clear.
Hey!  That's enough static out of you.
Cut it out now.  I'm warning you.
We just zeroed three kids in a heap.
Just walk over here quietly now--
You're making it tough on yourself, kid.  Come out quietly now.  You didn't kill anybody yet.
We got a cookaboo inside.  He wounded some kid earlier.
I don't know, lady.  Some kid's in trouble.  Stand back, please.
You going to tell me your name now?
Give him a couple of years.
Do you know why you shot those puppies, John?
Is that what they call you or do you have a nickname?
Can you tell me why you killed the puppies, Plato?
What do you think's going to happen, you do things like that?
Where did you get the gun?
Do you hear from him, son?
You know if the boy ever talked to a psychiatrist?
What gang does he belong to?
What makes you think he hates you, Judy?
He makes you feel pretty unhappy?
Do you think your father means that?
Is that why you were wandering around at one o'clock in the morning?
You weren't looking for company, were you?
Did you stop to talk to anyone, Judy?

Do you think you can get back at your Dad that way?  I mean sometimes if we can't get as close to somebody as we'd like we have to try making them jealous--so they'll have to pay attention.  Did you ever think of that?
Some kids stomped a man on Twelfth Street, Judy.
Would you like to go home if we can arrange it?
What's your number, Judy?  We'll see if your Dad will come and get you.
Unless you really don't want to go home.
Your mother will be down in a few minutes, Judy--
Your mother will be down in a few minutes.
He's a minor, Mr. Stark, and it looks to me like he had more than a little drink.
Whoa!  Whoa!  I know you're a little upset but--
What about you, Jim?  Got anything to say for yourself?
Hang loose, boy.  I'm warning you.
Big tough character.  You don't kid me, pal.  How come you're not wearing your boots?
Too bad you didn't connect.  You could have gone to Juvenile Hall.
Sure it is.  You want to bug us till we have to lock you up.  Why?
Go on--don't give me that.  Someone giving you hard looks?
You feel like you want to blow your wheels right now?
That why you moved from the last town? 'Cause you were in trouble?
You were getting a good start in the wrong direction back there.
But you don't think that's a solution.
Things pretty tough for you at home?
"If he could" what?  You mean your father?
You got me, Jim--but they do.  Want some water?
Here.  Look, will you do something for me?  If the pot starts boiling again, will you come and see me before you get yourself in a jam?
Any time--day or night.  You calmed down enough to go back now?
As much as you do--Loan me your mike, will you?
I am addressing the boy in the planetarium.  I am speaking to the boy inside.  This is Ray Framek from the Juvenile Division--
You are now surrounded.  You are surrounded by many armed police.
Come outside.  Clasp your hands over your head and come outside quietly--

Jim Stark!  I'm addressing Jim Stark.  Nobody will harm you or your friends if you follow these instructions.  We are here to protect you.  Drop your guns and come outside.  Nobody will hurt you if you do as I say--
It's all right!  It's all right!
I don't think.  I know.  He looks at me like I'm the ugliest thing in the world.  He doesn't like my friends--he--
He doesn't like anything about me--
He calls me a dirty tramp--my own father!

Yes!  I don't know!  I mean maybe he doesn't mean it but he acts like he does.  We're altogether and we're going to celebrate Easter and catch a double bill.  Big deal.  So I put on my new dress and I came out and he--

Yes--he started yelling for a handkerchief--screaming.  He grabbed my face and he rubbed all my lipstick off--he rubbed till I thought I wouldn't have any lips left.  And all the time yelling at me--that thing--the thing I told you he called me.  Then I ran out of the house.
I was just talking a walk.  I tried to call the kids but everybody was out and I couldn't find them.  I hate my life.  I just hate it.
No.  I don't even know why I do it.
I'll never get close to anybody.
You know where they picked me up!
You said you'd call my father.
What are you trying to do, get yourself killed?
Come out of the alley, Beau!  This is the last time I'm going to call you.
Beau!  All right--go to school alone!
University and 10th--Want to carry my books?
I'll bet you're a real yo yo.
I'm glad they let you out.
I heard about it.  You're lucky he lived.
Buzzie--we better get out of here.
You mean l'il ol' us?  What's the matter with the nice man?
I wasn't wishing.  I was looking at the moon.
But the same song.  I think it's fantastic!
Are you and Mom home tonight?
Nothing, only it'd be nice to spend an evening together for a change.
I guess I just don't understand anything.
Well, that's the main thing--don't you think so?
Want to finish my hamburger?  I only took a bite.
Even if I'm near a fire, I'm cold.
I'm sorry I treated you mean today.
If you knew me you wouldn't say that.
Have you ever gone with anyone who--
So have I.  But I've never been in love.  Isn't that awful?
Your lips are soft when you kiss.
I don't know, but we can't stay here.
I feel as if I'm walking under water.
You decide, darling.  Remember our budget.
Oh, we can manage that!  I'll scrimp and save and work my fingers to the bone...
You see, we've just--oh, you tell him, darling.  I'm so embarrassed I could die!
There's just one thing.  What about--
Yes.  And so terribly annoying when they cry.  I just don't know what to do when they cry, do you dear?
Your hand's all wet and it's shaky.
You don't need to do that.
I know already.  We don't have to pretend now.
Is this what it's like to love somebody?
Funny Jimmy.  You're so clean and you--this is silly.
I never felt so clean before.
I love somebody.  All the time I've been looking for someone to love me and now--I love somebody.  And it's so easy.  Why is it easy now?
I love you, Jim.  I really mean it.
After he tried to shoot you?
He needed you, maybe.  So do I.
You should have heard him talk about you tonight.  Like you were the hero in the China Seas.
She wouldn't give me their number.
Want me to imitate a stupid cop?
You want my jacket?  It's warm.
Why didn't you take my jacket?
Tell him why we moved here.
You buy me many things.  Thank you.
Stop tearing me apart!  You say one thing and he says another and then everybody changes back--
Someone should put poison in her epsom salts.
Boy, sometimes the temperature goes way up.
All the time!  I don't know what gets into me--but I keep looking for trouble and I always--I swear you better lock me up.  I'm going to smash somebody--I know it.
And they think they are protecting my by moving.
They think I'll make friends if we move.  Just move and everything'll be roses and sunshine.
She eats him alive and he takes it.
A zoo.  He always wants to be my pal, you know?  But how can I give him anything when he's--I mean I love him and I don't want to hurt him--but I don't know what to do anymore except maybe die.
I mean if he had the guts to knock Mom cold once I bet she'd be happy and I bet she'd stop picking.  They make mush out of him.  Just mush.
I bet you see right through me, don't you?
How can anyone grow up in this circus?
Boy--if I had one day when I didn't have to be all confused and ashamed of everything--or I felt I belonged some place.
Replies.Didascalie: (as RAY gets a cup of water from cooler)

Replies.Reply: Lovely!  Grandma--if you tell another lie you're going to turn to stone.
It'd stick in my throat, Mom.  I'm nervous or something--
You know something?  I have a feeling we're going to stay here.
Hey, didn't I see you before some place?
You don't have to be unfriendly.
"Life can be beautiful." Hey, I know where it was.
Yeah.  So where's the high school?
I was just getting my car.  I could take you.
Hi--can you tell we where I go?
Once you been up there, you know you been some place!
I don't want to make friends.
Hey, it's over.  The world ended.
I know.  That's why I came back.
I saw it.  Gee, look at that thing swing, will you?  Do you think it never stops?
Oh, I bet some little guy comes in here at night and pushes it.  Go-
You always at ringside?  You always travel in this rank company?
I thought only punks fought with knives.
All right--you want it, you got it!
You satisfied or you want more?
I scratched my mosquito bites.  I'm fine.
Let her see.  What could happen.
Hey--I want to ask you something.
Suppose you knew that you had to do something very dangerous--where you have to prove something you need to know--a question of honor.  Would you do it?
The kind we've been talking about.
What can you do when you have to be a man?
Just give me a direct answer!
You going to stop me from going, Dad?
Ten years?  Now, Dad--I need an answer now!
Boy, I bet you'd go to a hanging.
Buzz?  What are we doing this for?
I got to go in.  You better get home too.
I have to talk to someone, Mom.  I have to talk to you both.  And Dad this time you got to give me an answer.
I'm in terrible trouble.--You know that big high bluff near Miller-
It doesn't matter how.  I was driving a stolen car--
She never wants to hear.  She doesn't care!
I told you Dad, it was a question of honor.  They called me chicken--
I can't keep it to myself anymore--

That's not what I mean.  I've never done anything right.  I've been going around with my head in a sling for years...I don't want to drag you into this but I can't help it.  I don't think I can prove anything by going around pretending I'm tough any more, so maybe you look like one thing but you still feel like another.
Are you listening to me?  You're involved in this!  I want to go to the police and tell them I was mixed up in this thing tonight?
What's that got to do with it?
You don't want me to go.
But I am involved!  We're all involved, Mom!  A boy was killed!
Just tell a little white lie?
I don't want to learn that!
No!  You're not tearing me loose any more.

You're not going to use me as an excuse again, Mom.  Every time you can't face yourself you want to move and you say it's because of me or the neighborhood or some other phony excuse.  Now I want to do one thing right and I'm not letting you run away.
You better give me something, Dad.

Replies.Didascalie: (stops as he sees the emptiness in them)

Replies.Reply: Dad--answer her--aren't you going to stand up for me?
Excuse me--but--You know where I can find--I mean I don't remember his last name--
I think his first name's Ray--I have to see him.  It's very important.
My parents know I'm out.  They know I'm here.
They saw where I jumped!  I didn't chicken!  What do I have to do--
You were looking for me, weren't you?
I tried to call you before.
That's all I can do when I'm nervous.  Drink milk.  Here--have a slug.
I swear, sometimes, you just want to hold onto somebody!  Judy, what am I going to do?  I can't go home again.
You know something?  Sometimes I figure I'll never live to see my next birthday.  Isn't that dumb?
Every day I look in the mirror and say, "What?  You still here?" Man!
Like even today.  I woke up this morning, you know?  And the sun was shining and everything was nice.
Why'd you get mixed up with them?
I don't think you trust anybody, do you?
Where can we go?  I can't go back into that zoo.
How'd you find me?  What's happening?
Come out come out wherever you are!
Wowee ow wow!  Let's take it for the summer.
No--come on.  Should we rent or are we in a buying mood, dear?
Why don't we just rent it for the season?
Of course.  Drown them like puppies.
Nobody talks to children!  They just tell them one thing and mean another.
Let's see how long we can stay under.
I bet you hear everything I say!
How do you know so much about this junk, Plato?
You remember that far back?  Boy, I can't even remember yesterday.
You told me he's a big wheel in New York!
Ever been in a place like this before?
How many rooms do you think there are?
Hey!  Will you look at this room!
Want to read any books?  Take your pick!
Maybe he's scared of the dark.
There's something I should tell you, Judy.
It's not going to be lonely, Judy.
You crazy nut!  You crazy, crazy nut!
No!  I got to find him.
He didn't mean it--we shouldn't have left him.  He needed us.
He needs you too.  Come on.
Sure.  He was trying to make us his family.
Hey, I'm going to open the door now.
Boy, I'm blind as a bat!  You got a match?  I'm going to break my neck in here.  Where are you?
I know.  Light a match, will you?
I just have a feeling.  Where are you?
Well, stop hiding and stand up.  I can't talk to you if I don't see you.
Hey, look at the stars, Plato.
I'm not going to hurt you.
We didn't run out.  We were coming right back.
I promise nothing'll happen if you do.
You want my jacket?  It's warm.
You want to give me your gun now, Plato?
In your pocket.  Give it to me.
You trust me, don't you?  Just give it to me for a second.
Friends never break promises, do they?
Okay.  Here.  Now listen.  There are a lot of people outside and they all want you to be safe.  You understand that?  They said I could come in and bring you out.
Ray!  Will you tell these guys to move back?
But I've got the bullets!  The gun was empty!
What did you have to do that for?
Mom--Dad--this is my friend.  Her name is Judy.
You talk to the man nice now, hear?
She keep it to protect herself, sir.
Seems like she's always going somewhere.  She got a sister in Chicago and she go for the holiday.
They not together, sir.  We don't see him in a long time now.
Oh, Mrs. Crawford don't believe in them!
What you doing!  What you doing to him!  You clear out of here 'fore I call the police!
Clear out.  Go on!  Go on now!
Why you like to mix with bad boys like that?  Why you get in trouble all the--
You not going anywhere!  You staying home while your mama's away.
John!  What you doing with that!
John!  You stay home!  John!  John!
I got to know.  My boy run off tonight.  He had a gun with him, too.
This poor baby got nobody.  Just nobody.
Where were you tonight?  They called us at the club and I got the fright of my life!
Can't you answer?  What's the matter with you anyhow?
A minute ago you said you didn't care if he drinks.
That's a fine way to behave!
Your eggs are on the table, dear.
Sit down and eat--you'll be late.
There's nothing to be nervous about.
Well, there's a thermos of orange juice and some apple-sauce cake in the wax paper to wash it down.
He's home!  You're home!  You're all right!
What happened, darling.  We were so worried.  I was going to take a sleeping pill, but I wouldn't till I knew you were home.
Do you enjoy doing this to me or what--
And you wanted him to make a list!
I guess when I nearly died giving birth to you--that shows how much I don't care!
What about the other boys--Do you think they'll go to the police?
Why should you be the only one.
Are you going to preach now?  Are we going to have a sermon?
No!  I don't want you to go to the police!  There were other people and why should you be the only one involved!
He's not saying that!  He's saying don't volunteer!
Do I have to spell it out?
Jimmy, you're very young--and a foolish decision now could wreck your whole life.
Stop it!  You'll kill him!  Jim!
I don't know.  First I thought it was Jim but--
I still think you should go down.
I don't see what's so bad about taking a little drink.
No.  I definitely don't.  I did the sa--
I guess I cut pretty loose in my day too.
Listen--can't you wait till we get home?
Let me just explain to you--we just moved here, y'understand?  The kid has no friends yet and--
You mind if I try?  You have to slam the door in my face?
I try to get to him--what happens?
Don't I give you everything you want?  A bicycle--you get a bicycle.
Not just buy!  You hear all this talk about not lovely your kids enough.  We give you love and affection, don't we?
Then what is it?  I can't even touch you anymore but you pull away.
Was it because we went to that party?
You know what kind of drunken brawls those parties turn into--
My first day of school, mother'd make me eat and by golly I could never even swallow till recess--
So long, young fella.  Knock 'em dead, like your old man used to!
And listen--watch out about the pals you choose--Know what I mean?
It's just this get-up.  The girl's out and I was bringing Mom's supper.
I better clean this up before she sees it.
Listen--I took a steak out of the freezer.  I thought we could have a real old-fashioned stag party--just the two of us, what do you say?
Is there some kind of trick answer?
How'd that happen!  What kind of trouble you in?
Listen--nobody should make a snap decision--This isn't something you just--we ought to consider all the pros and cons--
We'll make time.  Where's some paper.  We'll make a list and if we're still stuck then we ought to get some advice--
You know I never stop you from anything.  Believe me--you're at a wonderful age.  In ten years you'll look back on this and wish you were a kid again.
I just want to show you how foolish you are.  When you're older you'll laugh at yourself for thinking this is so important--
Jim?  Will you listen?  You can't go out till we--Jim!
Sure--there was a bad accident there.  They showed the pictures on T.V.
Will you let him tell it!
Well, just get it off your chest, son.
Did anyone see you there?  I mean did they get your license number or anything?
Look Jim.  Far be it from me to tell you what to do, but there's--
I'm just explaining what you mean!
You know you did wrong.  That's the main thing, isn't it?
You'll learn as you get a little older, Jim.
Son--this is all happening so fast--
He's home.  I heard the car.
Oh, no, thanks.  I just wanted to--
No, honey.  No, he's not here.
I don't know.  Do you--do you know where he is?
Hey, come back here.  Who are you?
I think I know my son.
Let him alone!  He's mine!  I'll take care of him!
You did everything a man could do.
Stand up, Jim.  I'll stand up with you.  Let me try to be as strong as you want me to be.
And you can depend on me, son.
No, sir.  I just went next door to look at them like I always do.
I don't know.  End up in the electric chair?
He's a wheel.  So's she.  It's hard to make friends with them.
What does he know about Man alone?
I forgot something.  I'll get a hitch.
Listen, I told you not to fool with them.  Now they're waiting for you.
Jim--Do you think when the end of the world comes it'll be at night?
If you don't want trouble, I know a place we can go--
It's a big mansion and we could sneak around there and they wouldn't even know.  You could be safe--
Are you really going to meet them?
Oh, I don't know.  You have to get to know him.  He doesn't say much but when he does you know he means it.  He's sincere.
Maybe next summer he's going to take me hunting with him--and fishing.  I want him to teach me how and I bet he won't get mad if I goof.  His name's Jim.  It's really James but he likes Jim more.
People he really likes--he lets call him "Jamie."
Come on, Jim!  We got to get out of here!
Get up!  Get up!  Come on!
Why don't you come home with me?  I mean nobody's home at my house--and I'm not tired, are you?  I don't have many--people I can talk to.
If you want to come we could talk and then in the morning we could have breakfast like my dad used to--
O.K.  G'night.  I got to pick up my scooter.  See you tomorrow.
Listen, you guys ought to go home.
My old man's got a gun.
I have to go out.  I have to warn him.
Hope I didn't bother you.  Goodnight.
Everybody!  Crunch and Goon and everybody!  I think they're going to kill you.
They think you told the police on them.  They--who's in there?
Don't give it a thought.  Only three million dollars a month!
Children?  Well, we really don't encourage them.  They're so noisy and troublesome, don't you agree?
Shall I show you the nursery?  It's far away from the rest of the house.
It's wonderful that you understand so well--and so young too!  You know the most wonderful feature about the nursery?
Haven't you noticed your personality splitting?
I had to go to a head-shrinker.  I only went twice though.  My mother said it cost too much, so she went to Hawaii instead.
I don't know but whatever it is, it's gone now.  I mean I'm happy now.  Here.
When I was here?  When I ran away.
Mom and Dad.  I used to be in my crib and I'd listen to them fight.
He's dead.  He was a hero in the China Sea.
I did?  Well, he might as well be dead.  What's the difference?
What you run out on me for!  What you leave me alone for?
I don't want you for my father!
You think the end of the world will come at nighttime, Jim?
Why did you run out on me?
You promised to give it back.
I shot at one of them.
Those aren't my friends.  Make them go away.
Keep away from me!  I don't believe you anymore!
Well you know who he takes after!
This was all very unfortunate, but he made a mistake and he's sorry--
It's a wonder we don't all have TB or some other terrible disease after living in all those smokey cities!
There aren't so many factories here.
What did I tell you?  Peanut butter!
For many days before the end of our earth people will look into the night sky and notice a star, increasingly bright and increasingly near.
As this star approaches us, the weather will change.  The great polar fields of the north and south will rot and divide, and the seas will turn warmer.
The last of us search the heavens and stand amazed.  For the stars will still be there, moving through their ancient rhythms.
The familiar constellations that illuminate our night will seem as they have always seemed, eternal, unchanged and little moved by the shortness of time between our planet's birth and its demise.
Sagittarius and Aries--all as they have ever been.
And while the flash of our beginning has not yet traveled the light years into distance--
Has not yet been seen by planets deep within the other galaxies, we will disappear into the blackness of the space from which we came.
Destroyed as we began in a burst of gas and fire.
The heavens are still and cold once more.  In all the complexity of our universe and the galaxies beyond, the Earth will not be missed.
Through the infinite reaches of space, the problems of Man seem trivial and naive indeed.  And Man, existing alone, seems to be an episode of little consequences.
That's all.  Thank you very much.
Oh, I don't think so.  From the school?
Don't lose control, Mr. Jamison.  I think if we just explain--
Sometimes the world is too much with us, isn't it, son?  What was the disturbance?
You're bleeding.  Are you all right?
I bet he fights with cows.
Down there!  Down there is Buzz!
This place appeal to you or something?
You monsters start home.  We're going to--
He's going to cheese, I tell you.
No.  We're going to bring him down.
You clean out of your head?  Come on!
You know what we want.  We want your friend.
You better tell us and I'm not kidding.
Hang loose.  We got all night.
You still want to go home, Moose?
Then shut your mouth before your guts run out!
You scam a car up there?
Nobody's lived in that hunk of junk for five-six years.
Well, what do you know!  I feel a kick coming on!
Moose!  Take the steps!  Goon!  The other side.
Well, you going to wait all night?
His old man's got a gun.  What do you think of that!

Replies.Didascalie: (drives a hard blow at PLATO's belly)

Replies.Reply: May I have your attention?  May I please have your attention?
Le soleil tombe dans la mer.
You think you're tough?  I got a son twice your size and I can still handle him.
Explain to these?  They think they own the world!
Buzzy!  Look out!  He's got a chain!
The bluff, Buzz!  That's dangerous up there.
The world goes round the sun!
Time now for the seven o'clock news.
Coming up now another request--this time from the boys down at Anna's Pizza Paradise--A new arrangement of a great oldie in rhythm and blues.  Jim, this is dedicated to you--from Buzz.
Got some goodies for you, Buzzie-boy.
Clean as a whistle.  They both got plenty breeze.
Nothing, Crunch.  They picked him up like the rest of--
I think I should go home.
Crunch--my father's--You going to kill him?
That maid saw us.  She could identify us too.
O-W-I-C-Z.  Wojtowicz.  What's the matter, man?  That's the craziest name in town!  It swings!
Man, this cat never stops.  He just keeps going like Big Jay at a session!
He's writing a book about me--
Where's your baby boy gone to, Daddy?  We want him.
Take the house!  I'll head him off.
We heard firing.  He get anybody?
Officers!  Another boy and girl just ran into the planetarium.  We do not know if they are armed.
Ambulance.  Ambulance is coming through.  Clear a passage.  Will you people make way there?
